00036  * iam_lvar.c
00037  *
00038  * implementation of iam format for fixed size records, variable sized keys.
00039  *
00040  * Author: Nikita Danilov <nikita@clusterfs.com>
00041  */

00046 /*
00047  * Leaf operations.
00048  */
00049 
00050 enum {
00051         IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC = 0x1973 /* This is duplicated in
00052                                       * lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00053 };
00054 
00055 /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00056 struct lvar_leaf_header {
00057         __le16 vlh_magic; /* magic number IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC */
00058         __le16 vlh_used;  /* used bytes, including header */
00059 };
00060 
00061 /*
00062  * Format of leaf entry:
00063  *
00064  * __le16 keysize
00065  *     u8 key[keysize]
00066  *     u8 record[rec_size]
00067  *
00068  * Entries are ordered in key order.
00069  */
00070 
00071 /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00072 typedef __u32 lvar_hash_t;
00073 
00074 /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00075 struct lvar_leaf_entry {
00076         __le32 vle_hash;
00077         __le16 vle_keysize;
00078         u8     vle_key[0];
00079 };
00080 
00081 #define PDIFF(ptr0, ptr1) (((char *)(ptr0)) - ((char *)(ptr1)))
00082 
00083 
00084 static inline int blocksize(const struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00085 {
00086         return iam_leaf_container(leaf)->ic_object->i_sb->s_blocksize;
00087 }
00088 
00089 static inline const char *kchar(const struct iam_key *key)
00090 {
00091         return (void *)key;
00092 }

00094 static inline struct iam_lentry *lvar_lentry(const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00095 {
00096         return (struct iam_lentry *)ent;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline struct lvar_leaf_entry *lentry_lvar(const struct iam_lentry *lent)
00100 {
00101         return (struct lvar_leaf_entry *)lent;
00102 }

00105 static inline int e_keysize(const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00106 {
00107         return le16_to_cpu(ent->vle_keysize);
00108 }
00109 
00110 /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00111 enum {
00112         LVAR_PAD   = 4,
00113         LVAR_ROUND = LVAR_PAD - 1
00114 };
00115 
00116 static inline int getsize(const struct iam_leaf *leaf, int namelen, int recsize)
00117 {
00118         CLASSERT(!(LVAR_PAD & (LVAR_PAD - 1)));
00119 
00120         return (offsetof(struct lvar_leaf_entry, vle_key) +
00121                 namelen + recsize + LVAR_ROUND) & ~LVAR_ROUND;
00122 }
00123 
00124 static inline int rec_size(const struct iam_rec *rec)
00125 {
00126         return *(const char *)rec;
00127 }
00128 
00129 static inline struct iam_rec *e_rec(const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00130 {
00131         return ((void *)ent) +
00132                 offsetof(struct lvar_leaf_entry, vle_key) + e_keysize(ent);
00133 }
00134 
00135 static inline int e_size(const struct iam_leaf *leaf,
00136                          const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00137 {
00138         return getsize(leaf, e_keysize(ent), rec_size(e_rec(ent)));
00139 }
00140 
00141 static inline char *e_char(const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00142 {
00143         return (char *)&ent->vle_key;
00144 }
00145 
00146 static inline struct iam_key *e_key(const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00147 {
00148         return (struct iam_key *)e_char(ent);
00149 }
00150 
00151 static inline lvar_hash_t e_hash(const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00152 {
00153         return le32_to_cpu(ent->vle_hash);
00154 }
00155 
00156 static void e_print(const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00157 {
00158         printk("        %p %8.8x \"%*.*s\"\n", ent, e_hash(ent),
00159                e_keysize(ent), e_keysize(ent), e_char(ent));
00160 }
00161 #if 0
00162 static int e_check(const struct iam_leaf *leaf,
00163                    const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00164 {
00165         const void *point = ent;
00166         const void *start = leaf->il_bh->b_data;
00167         return
00168                 start + sizeof(struct lvar_leaf_header) <= point &&
00169                 point + e_size(leaf, ent) < start + blocksize(leaf);
00170 }
00171 #endif
00172 
00173 static inline struct lvar_leaf_entry *e_next(const struct iam_leaf *leaf,
00174                                              const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent)
00175 {
00176         return ((void *)ent) + e_size(leaf, ent);
00177 }
00178 
00179 #define LVAR_HASH_SANDWICH  (0)
00180 #define LVAR_HASH_TEA       (1)
00181 #define LVAR_HASH_R5        (0)
00182 #define LVAR_HASH_PREFIX    (0)
00183 
00184 static __u32 hash_build0(const char *name, int namelen)
00185 {
00186         __u32 result;
00187 
00188         if (namelen == 0)
00189                 return 0;
00190         if (strncmp(name, ".", 1) == 0 && namelen == 1)
00191                 return 1;
00192         if (strncmp(name, "..", 2) == 0 && namelen == 2)
00193                 return 2;
00194 
00195         if (LVAR_HASH_PREFIX) {
00196                 result = 0;
00197                 strncpy((void *)&result,
00198                         name, min(namelen, (int)sizeof result));
00199         } else {
00200                 struct ldiskfs_dx_hash_info hinfo;
00201 
00202                 hinfo.hash_version = LDISKFS_DX_HASH_TEA;
00203                 hinfo.seed = NULL;
00204                 ldiskfsfs_dirhash(name, namelen, &hinfo);
00205                 result = hinfo.hash;
00206                 if (LVAR_HASH_SANDWICH) {
00207                         __u32 result2;
00208 
00209                         hinfo.hash_version = LDISKFS_DX_HASH_TEA;
00210                         hinfo.seed = NULL;
00211                         ldiskfsfs_dirhash(name, namelen, &hinfo);
00212                         result2 = hinfo.hash;
00213                         result = (0xfc000000 & result2) | (0x03ffffff & result);
00214                 }
00215         }
00216         return result;
00217 }
00218 
00219 enum {
00220         HASH_GRAY_AREA = 1024,
00221         HASH_MAX_SIZE  = 0x7fffffffUL
00222 };
00223 
00224 static __u32 hash_build(const char *name, int namelen)
00225 {
00226         __u32 hash;
00227 
00228         hash = (hash_build0(name, namelen) << 1) & HASH_MAX_SIZE;
00229         if (hash > HASH_MAX_SIZE - HASH_GRAY_AREA)
00230                 hash &= HASH_GRAY_AREA - 1;
00231         return hash;
00232 }
00233 
00234 static inline lvar_hash_t get_hash(const struct iam_container *bag,
00235                                    const char *name, int namelen)
00236 {
00237         return hash_build(name, namelen);
00238 }
00239 
00240 static inline int e_eq(const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent,
00241                        const char *name, int namelen)
00242 {
00243         return namelen == e_keysize(ent) && !memcmp(e_char(ent), name, namelen);
00244 }
00245 
00246 static inline int e_cmp(const struct iam_leaf *leaf,
00247                         const struct lvar_leaf_entry *ent, lvar_hash_t hash)
00248 {
00249         lvar_hash_t ehash;
00250 
00251         ehash = e_hash(ent);
00252         return ehash == hash ? 0 : (ehash < hash ? -1 : +1);
00253 }
00254 
00255 static struct lvar_leaf_header *n_head(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00256 {
00257         return (struct lvar_leaf_header *)l->il_bh->b_data;
00258 }
00259 
00260 static int h_used(const struct lvar_leaf_header *hdr)
00261 {
00262         return le16_to_cpu(hdr->vlh_used);
00263 }
00264 
00265 static void h_used_adj(const struct iam_leaf *leaf,
00266                        struct lvar_leaf_header *hdr, int adj)
00267 {
00268         int used;
00269 
00270         used = h_used(hdr) + adj;
00271         assert_corr(sizeof *hdr <= used && used <= blocksize(leaf));
00272         hdr->vlh_used = cpu_to_le16(used);
00273 }
00274 
00275 static struct lvar_leaf_entry *n_start(const struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00276 {
00277         return (void *)leaf->il_bh->b_data + sizeof(struct lvar_leaf_header);
00278 }
00279 
00280 static struct lvar_leaf_entry *n_end(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00281 {
00282         return (void *)l->il_bh->b_data + h_used(n_head(l));
00283 }
00284 
00285 static struct lvar_leaf_entry *n_cur(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00286 {
00287         return lentry_lvar(l->il_at);
00288 }
00289 
00290 void n_print(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00291 {
00292         struct lvar_leaf_entry *scan;
00293 
00294         printk(KERN_EMERG "used: %d\n", h_used(n_head(l)));
00295         for (scan = n_start(l); scan < n_end(l); scan = e_next(l, scan))
00296                 e_print(scan);
00297 }
00298 
00299 #if LDISKFS_CORRECTNESS_ON
00300 static int n_at_rec(const struct iam_leaf *folio)
00301 {
00302         return
00303                 n_start(folio) <= lentry_lvar(folio->il_at) &&
00304                 lentry_lvar(folio->il_at) < n_end(folio);
00305 }
00306 
00307 #if LDISKFS_INVARIANT_ON
00308 static int n_invariant(const struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00309 {
00310         struct iam_path        *path;
00311         struct lvar_leaf_entry *scan;
00312         struct lvar_leaf_entry *end;
00313         lvar_hash_t             hash;
00314         lvar_hash_t             nexthash;
00315         lvar_hash_t             starthash;
00316 
00317         end  = n_end(leaf);
00318         hash = 0;
00319         path = leaf->il_path;
00320 
00321         if (h_used(n_head(leaf)) > blocksize(leaf))
00322                 return 0;
00323 
00324         /*
00325          * Delimiting key in the parent index node. Clear least bit to account
00326          * for hash collision marker.
00327          */
00328         starthash = *(lvar_hash_t *)iam_ikey_at(path, path->ip_frame->at) & ~1;
00329         for (scan = n_start(leaf); scan < end; scan = e_next(leaf, scan)) {
00330                 nexthash = e_hash(scan);
00331                 if (nexthash != get_hash(iam_leaf_container(leaf),
00332                                          e_char(scan), e_keysize(scan))) {
00333                         BREAKPOINT();
00334                         return 0;
00335                 }
00336                 if (0 && nexthash < starthash) {
00337                         /*
00338                          * Unfortunately this useful invariant cannot be
00339                          * reliably checked as parent node is nor necessarily
00340                          * locked.
00341                          */
00342                         n_print(leaf);
00343                         printk("%#x < %#x\n", nexthash, starthash);
00344                         dump_stack();
00345                         return 0;
00346                 }
00347                 if (nexthash < hash) {
00348                         BREAKPOINT();
00349                         return 0;
00350                 }
00351                 hash = nexthash;
00352         }
00353         if (scan != end) {
00354                 BREAKPOINT();
00355                 return 0;
00356         }
00357         return 1;
00358 }
00359 /* LDISKFS_INVARIANT_ON */
00360 #endif
00361 
00362 /* LDISKFS_CORRECTNESS_ON */
00363 #endif
00364 
00365 static struct iam_ikey *lvar_ikey(const struct iam_leaf *l,
00366                                   struct iam_ikey *key)
00367 {
00368         lvar_hash_t *hash;
00369 
00370         assert_corr(n_at_rec(l));
00371 
00372         hash = (void *)key;
00373         *hash = e_hash(n_cur(l));
00374         return key;
00375 }
00376 
00377 static struct iam_key *lvar_key(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00378 {
00379         return e_key(n_cur(l));
00380 }
00381 
00382 static int lvar_key_size(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00383 {
00384         return e_keysize(n_cur(l));
00385 }
00386 
00387 static void lvar_start(struct iam_leaf *l)
00388 {
00389         l->il_at = lvar_lentry(n_start(l));
00390 }
00391 
00392 static int lvar_init(struct iam_leaf *l)
00393 {
00394         int result;
00395         int used;
00396         struct lvar_leaf_header *head;
00397 
00398         assert_corr(l->il_bh != NULL);
00399 
00400         head = n_head(l);
00401         used = h_used(head);
00402         if (le16_to_cpu(head->vlh_magic) == IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC &&
00403             used <= blocksize(l)) {
00404                 l->il_at = l->il_entries = lvar_lentry(n_start(l));
00405                 result = 0;
00406         } else {
00407                 struct inode *obj;
00408 
00409                 obj = iam_leaf_container(l)->ic_object;
00410                 CERROR("Wrong magic in node %llu (#%lu): %#x != %#x or "
00411                        "wrong used: %d\n",
00412                        (unsigned long long)l->il_bh->b_blocknr, obj->i_ino,
00413                        le16_to_cpu(head->vlh_magic), IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC,
00414                        used);
00415                 result = -EIO;
00416         }
00417         return result;
00418 }
00419 
00420 static void lvar_fini(struct iam_leaf *l)
00421 {
00422         l->il_entries = l->il_at = NULL;
00423 }
00424 
00425 static struct iam_rec *lvar_rec(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00426 {
00427         assert_corr(n_at_rec(l));
00428         return e_rec(n_cur(l));
00429 }
00430 
00431 static void lvar_next(struct iam_leaf *l)
00432 {
00433         assert_corr(n_at_rec(l));
00434         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(l));
00435         l->il_at = lvar_lentry(e_next(l, n_cur(l)));
00436 }
00437 
00438 static int lvar_lookup(struct iam_leaf *leaf, const struct iam_key *k)
00439 {
00440         struct lvar_leaf_entry *found;
00441         struct lvar_leaf_entry *scan;
00442         struct lvar_leaf_entry *end;
00443         int                     result;
00444         const char             *name;
00445         int                     namelen;
00446         int                     found_equal;
00447         lvar_hash_t             hash;
00448         int                     last;
00449 
00450         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00451         end = n_end(leaf);
00452 
00453         name = kchar(k);
00454         namelen = strlen(name);
00455         hash = get_hash(iam_leaf_container(leaf), name, namelen);
00456         found = NULL;
00457         found_equal = 0;
00458         last = 1;
00459 
00460         for (scan = n_start(leaf); scan < end; scan = e_next(leaf, scan)) {
00461                 lvar_hash_t scan_hash;
00462 
00463                 scan_hash = e_hash(scan);
00464                 if (scan_hash < hash)
00465                         found = scan;
00466                 else if (scan_hash == hash) {
00467                         if (e_eq(scan, name, namelen)) {
00468                                 /*
00469                                  * perfect match
00470                                  */
00471                                 leaf->il_at = lvar_lentry(scan);
00472                                 return IAM_LOOKUP_EXACT;
00473                         } else if (!found_equal) {
00474                                         found = scan;
00475                                         found_equal = 1;
00476                         }
00477                 } else {
00478                         last = 0;
00479                         break;
00480                 }
00481         }
00482         if (found == NULL) {
00483                 /*
00484                  * @k is less than all hashes in the leaf.
00485                  */
00486                 lvar_start(leaf);
00487                 result = IAM_LOOKUP_BEFORE;
00488         } else {
00489                 leaf->il_at = lvar_lentry(found);
00490                 result = IAM_LOOKUP_OK;
00491                 assert_corr(n_at_rec(leaf));
00492         }
00493         if (last)
00494                 result |= IAM_LOOKUP_LAST;
00495         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00496 
00497         return result;
00498 }
00499 
00500 static int lvar_ilookup(struct iam_leaf *leaf, const struct iam_ikey *ik)
00501 {
00502         struct lvar_leaf_entry *scan;
00503         struct lvar_leaf_entry *end;
00504         lvar_hash_t             hash;
00505 
00506         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00507         end  = n_end(leaf);
00508         hash = *(const lvar_hash_t *)ik;
00509 
00510         lvar_start(leaf);
00511         for (scan = n_start(leaf); scan < end; scan = e_next(leaf, scan)) {
00512                 lvar_hash_t scan_hash;
00513 
00514                 scan_hash = e_hash(scan);
00515                 if (scan_hash > hash)
00516                         return scan == n_start(leaf) ?
00517                                 IAM_LOOKUP_BEFORE : IAM_LOOKUP_OK;
00518                 leaf->il_at = lvar_lentry(scan);
00519                 if (scan_hash == hash)
00520                         return IAM_LOOKUP_EXACT;
00521         }
00522         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00523         /*
00524          * @ik is greater than any key in the node. Return last record in the
00525          * node.
00526          */
00527         return IAM_LOOKUP_OK;
00528 }
00529 
00530 static void __lvar_key_set(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k)
00531 {
00532         memcpy(e_key(n_cur(l)), k, e_keysize(n_cur(l)));
00533 }
00534 
00535 static void lvar_key_set(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k)
00536 {
00537         assert_corr(n_at_rec(l));
00538         assert_corr(strlen(kchar(k)) == e_keysize(n_cur(l)));
00539         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(l));
00540         __lvar_key_set(l, k);
00541         assert_inv(n_invariant(l));
00542 }
00543 
00544 static int lvar_key_cmp(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k)
00545 {
00546         lvar_hash_t hash;
00547         const char *name;
00548 
00549         name = kchar(k);
00550 
00551         hash = get_hash(iam_leaf_container(l), name, strlen(name));
00552         return e_cmp(l, n_cur(l), hash);
00553 }
00554 
00555 static int lvar_key_eq(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k)
00556 {
00557         const char *name;
00558 
00559         name = kchar(k);
00560         return e_eq(n_cur(l), name, strlen(name));
00561 }
00562 
00563 static void __lvar_rec_set(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_rec *r)
00564 {
00565         memcpy(e_rec(n_cur(l)), r, rec_size(r));
00566 }
00567 
00568 static void lvar_rec_set(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_rec *r)
00569 {
00570         assert_corr(n_at_rec(l));
00571         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(l));
00572         __lvar_rec_set(l, r);
00573         assert_inv(n_invariant(l));
00574 }
00575 
00576 static int lvar_rec_eq(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_rec *r)
00577 {
00578         struct iam_rec *rec = e_rec(n_cur(l));
00579 
00580         if (rec_size(rec) != rec_size(r))
00581                 return 0;
00582         return !memcmp(rec, r, rec_size(r));
00583 }
00584 
00585 static void lvar_rec_get(const struct iam_leaf *l, struct iam_rec *r)
00586 {
00587         struct iam_rec *rec;
00588 
00589         rec = e_rec(n_cur(l));
00590         assert_corr(n_at_rec(l));
00591         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(l));
00592         memcpy(r, rec, rec_size(rec));
00593         assert_inv(n_invariant(l));
00594 }
00595 
00596 static int lvar_can_add(const struct iam_leaf *l,
00597                         const struct iam_key *k, const struct iam_rec *r)
00598 {
00599         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(l));
00600         return
00601                 h_used(n_head(l)) +
00602                 getsize(l, strlen(kchar(k)), rec_size(r)) <= blocksize(l);
00603 }
00604 
00605 static int lvar_at_end(const struct iam_leaf *folio)
00606 {
00607         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(folio));
00608         return n_cur(folio) == n_end(folio);
00609 }
00610 
00611 static void lvar_rec_add(struct iam_leaf *leaf,
00612                          const struct iam_key *k, const struct iam_rec *r)
00613 {
00614         const char *key;
00615         int   ksize;
00616         int   shift;
00617         void *end;
00618         void *start;
00619         ptrdiff_t diff;
00620 
00621         assert_corr(lvar_can_add(leaf, k, r));
00622         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00623         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(leaf));
00624 
00625         key   = kchar(k);
00626         ksize = strlen(key);
00627         shift = getsize(leaf, ksize, rec_size(r));
00628 
00629         if (!lvar_at_end(leaf)) {
00630                 assert_corr(n_cur(leaf) < n_end(leaf));
00631                 end = n_end(leaf);
00632                 if (lvar_key_cmp(leaf, k) <= 0)
00633                         lvar_next(leaf);
00634                 else
00635                         /*
00636                          * Another exceptional case: insertion with the key
00637                          * less than least key in the leaf.
00638                          */
00639                         assert_corr(leaf->il_at == leaf->il_entries);
00640 
00641                 start = leaf->il_at;
00642                 diff  = PDIFF(end, start);
00643                 assert_corr(diff >= 0);
00644                 memmove(start + shift, start, diff);
00645         }
00646         h_used_adj(leaf, n_head(leaf), shift);
00647         n_cur(leaf)->vle_keysize = cpu_to_le16(ksize);
00648         n_cur(leaf)->vle_hash = cpu_to_le32(get_hash(iam_leaf_container(leaf),
00649                                                      key, ksize));
00650         __lvar_key_set(leaf, k);
00651         __lvar_rec_set(leaf, r);
00652         assert_corr(n_at_rec(leaf));
00653         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00654 }
00655 
00656 static void lvar_rec_del(struct iam_leaf *leaf, int shift)
00657 {
00658         void *next;
00659         void *end;
00660         int nob;
00661 
00662         assert_corr(n_at_rec(leaf));
00663         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00664         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(leaf));
00665 
00666         end  = n_end(leaf);
00667         next = e_next(leaf, n_cur(leaf));
00668         nob  = e_size(leaf, n_cur(leaf));
00669         memmove(leaf->il_at, next, end - next);
00670         h_used_adj(leaf, n_head(leaf), -nob);
00671         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00672 }
00673 
00674 static void lvar_init_new(struct iam_container *c, struct buffer_head *bh)
00675 {
00676         struct lvar_leaf_header *hdr;
00677 
00678         hdr = (struct lvar_leaf_header *)bh->b_data;
00679         hdr->vlh_magic = cpu_to_le16(IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC);
00680         hdr->vlh_used  = sizeof *hdr;
00681 }
00682 
00683 static struct lvar_leaf_entry *find_pivot(const struct iam_leaf *leaf,
00684                                           struct lvar_leaf_entry **prev)
00685 {
00686         void *scan;
00687         void *start;
00688         int threshold;
00689 
00690         *prev = NULL;
00691         threshold = blocksize(leaf) / 2;
00692         for (scan = start = n_start(leaf); scan - start <= threshold;
00693              *prev = scan, scan = e_next(leaf, scan)) {
00694                 ;
00695         }
00696         return scan;
00697 }
00698 
00699 static void lvar_split(struct iam_leaf *leaf, struct buffer_head **bh,
00700                        iam_ptr_t new_blknr)
00701 {
00702         struct lvar_leaf_entry  *first_to_move;
00703         struct lvar_leaf_entry  *last_to_stay;
00704         struct iam_path         *path;
00705         struct lvar_leaf_header *hdr;
00706         struct buffer_head      *new_leaf;
00707 
00708         ptrdiff_t   tomove;
00709         lvar_hash_t hash;
00710 
00711         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00712         assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(leaf));
00713 
00714         new_leaf = *bh;
00715         path = iam_leaf_path(leaf);
00716 
00717         hdr = (void *)new_leaf->b_data;
00718 
00719         first_to_move = find_pivot(leaf, &last_to_stay);
00720         assert_corr(last_to_stay != NULL);
00721         assert_corr(e_next(leaf, last_to_stay) == first_to_move);
00722 
00723         hash = e_hash(first_to_move);
00724         if (hash == e_hash(last_to_stay))
00725                 /*
00726                  * Duplicate hash.
00727                  */
00728                 hash |= 1;
00729 
00730         tomove = PDIFF(n_end(leaf), first_to_move);
00731         memmove(hdr + 1, first_to_move, tomove);
00732 
00733         h_used_adj(leaf, hdr, tomove);
00734         h_used_adj(leaf, n_head(leaf), -tomove);
00735 
00736         assert_corr(n_end(leaf) == first_to_move);
00737 
00738         if (n_cur(leaf) >= first_to_move) {
00739                 /*
00740                  * insertion point moves into new leaf.
00741                  */
00742                 ptrdiff_t shift;
00743                 int result;
00744 
00745                 shift = PDIFF(leaf->il_at, first_to_move);
00746                 *bh = leaf->il_bh;
00747                 leaf->il_bh = new_leaf;
00748                 leaf->il_curidx = new_blknr;
00749 
00750                 assert_corr(iam_leaf_is_locked(leaf));
00751                 result = lvar_init(leaf);
00752                 /*
00753                  * init cannot fail, as node was just initialized.
00754                  */
00755                 assert_corr(result == 0);
00756                 leaf->il_at = ((void *)leaf->il_at) + shift;
00757         }
00758         /*
00759          * Insert pointer to the new node (together with the least key in
00760          * the node) into index node.
00761          */
00762         iam_insert_key_lock(path, path->ip_frame, (struct iam_ikey *)&hash,
00763                             new_blknr);
00764         assert_corr(n_cur(leaf) < n_end(leaf));
00765         assert_inv(n_invariant(leaf));
00766 }
00767 
00768 static int lvar_leaf_empty(struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00769 {
00770         return h_used(n_head(leaf)) == sizeof(struct lvar_leaf_header);
00771 }
00772 
00773 static struct iam_leaf_operations lvar_leaf_ops = {
00774         .init           = lvar_init,
00775         .init_new       = lvar_init_new,
00776         .fini           = lvar_fini,
00777         .start          = lvar_start,
00778         .next           = lvar_next,
00779         .key            = lvar_key,
00780         .ikey           = lvar_ikey,
00781         .rec            = lvar_rec,
00782         .key_set        = lvar_key_set,
00783         .key_cmp        = lvar_key_cmp,
00784         .key_eq         = lvar_key_eq,
00785         .key_size       = lvar_key_size,
00786         .rec_set        = lvar_rec_set,
00787         .rec_eq         = lvar_rec_eq,
00788         .rec_get        = lvar_rec_get,
00789         .lookup         = lvar_lookup,
00790         .ilookup        = lvar_ilookup,
00791         .at_end         = lvar_at_end,
00792         .rec_add        = lvar_rec_add,
00793         .rec_del        = lvar_rec_del,
00794         .can_add        = lvar_can_add,
00795         .split          = lvar_split,
00796         .leaf_empty     = lvar_leaf_empty,
00797 };
00798 
00799 /*
00800  * Index operations.
00801  */
00802 
00803 enum {
00804         /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00805         /* egrep -i '^o?x?[olabcdef]*$' /usr/share/dict/words */
00806         IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC = 0xb01dface
00807 };
00808 
00809 /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00810 struct lvar_root {
00811         __le32 vr_magic;
00812         __le16 vr_recsize;
00813         __le16 vr_ptrsize;
00814         u8     vr_indirect_levels;
00815         u8     vr_padding0;
00816         __le16 vr_padding1;
00817 };
00818 
00819 static __u32 lvar_root_ptr(struct iam_container *c)
00820 {
00821         return 0;
00822 }
00823 
00824 static int lvar_node_init(struct iam_container *c, struct buffer_head *bh,
00825                           int root)
00826 {
00827         return 0;
00828 }
00829 
00830 static struct iam_entry *lvar_root_inc(struct iam_container *c,
00831                                        struct iam_path *path,
00832                                        struct iam_frame *frame)
00833 {
00834         struct lvar_root *root;
00835         struct iam_entry *entries;
00836 
00837         assert_corr(iam_frame_is_locked(path, frame));
00838         entries = frame->entries;
00839 
00840         dx_set_count(entries, 2);
00841         assert_corr(dx_get_limit(entries) == dx_root_limit(path));
00842 
00843         root = (void *)frame->bh->b_data;
00844         assert_corr(le64_to_cpu(root->vr_magic) == IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC);
00845         root->vr_indirect_levels ++;
00846         frame->at = entries = iam_entry_shift(path, entries, 1);
00847         memset(iam_ikey_at(path, entries), 0,
00848                iam_path_descr(path)->id_ikey_size);
00849         return entries;
00850 }
00851 
00852 static int lvar_node_check(struct iam_path *path, struct iam_frame *frame)
00853 {
00854         unsigned count;
00855         unsigned limit;
00856         unsigned limit_correct;
00857         struct iam_entry *entries;
00858 
00859         entries = dx_node_get_entries(path, frame);
00860 
00861         if (frame == path->ip_frames) {
00862                 struct lvar_root *root;
00863 
00864                 root = (void *)frame->bh->b_data;
00865                 if (le32_to_cpu(root->vr_magic) != IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC)
00866                         return -EIO;
00867                 limit_correct = dx_root_limit(path);
00868         } else
00869                 limit_correct = dx_node_limit(path);
00870         count = dx_get_count(entries);
00871         limit = dx_get_limit(entries);
00872         if (count > limit)
00873                 return -EIO;
00874         if (limit != limit_correct)
00875                 return -EIO;
00876         return 0;
00877 }
00878 
00879 static int lvar_node_load(struct iam_path *path, struct iam_frame *frame)
00880 {
00881         struct iam_entry *entries;
00882         void *data;
00883         entries = dx_node_get_entries(path, frame);
00884 
00885         data = frame->bh->b_data;
00886 
00887         if (frame == path->ip_frames) {
00888                 struct lvar_root *root;
00889                 const char *name;
00890 
00891                 root = data;
00892                 name = kchar(path->ip_key_target);
00893                 path->ip_indirect = root->vr_indirect_levels;
00894                 if (path->ip_ikey_target == NULL) {
00895                         path->ip_ikey_target = iam_path_ikey(path, 4);
00896                         *(lvar_hash_t *)path->ip_ikey_target =
00897                                 get_hash(path->ip_container, name,
00898                                          strlen(name));
00899                 }
00900         }
00901         frame->entries = frame->at = entries;
00902         return 0;
00903 }
00904 
00905 static int lvar_ikeycmp(const struct iam_container *c,
00906                         const struct iam_ikey *k1, const struct iam_ikey *k2)
00907 {
00908         lvar_hash_t p1 = le32_to_cpu(*(lvar_hash_t *)k1);
00909         lvar_hash_t p2 = le32_to_cpu(*(lvar_hash_t *)k2);
00910 
00911         return p1 > p2 ? +1 : (p1 < p2 ? -1 : 0);
00912 }
00913 
00914 static struct iam_path_descr *lvar_ipd_alloc(const struct iam_container *c,
00915                                              void *area)
00916 {
00917         return iam_ipd_alloc(area, c->ic_descr->id_ikey_size);
00918 }
00919 
00920 static void lvar_root(void *buf,
00921                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00922 {
00923         struct lvar_root *root;
00924         struct dx_countlimit *limit;
00925         void                 *entry;
00926         int isize;
00927 
00928         isize = sizeof(lvar_hash_t) + ptrsize;
00929         root = buf;
00930         *root = (typeof(*root)) {
00931                 .vr_magic            = cpu_to_le32(IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC),
00932                 .vr_recsize          = cpu_to_le16(recsize),
00933                 .vr_ptrsize          = cpu_to_le16(ptrsize),
00934                 .vr_indirect_levels  = 0
00935         };
00936 
00937         limit = (void *)(root + 1);
00938         *limit = (typeof(*limit)){
00939                 /*
00940                  * limit itself + one pointer to the leaf.
00941                  */
00942                 .count = cpu_to_le16(2),
00943                 .limit = iam_root_limit(sizeof(struct lvar_root), blocksize,
00944                                         sizeof (lvar_hash_t) + ptrsize)
00945         };
00946 
00947         /* To guarantee that the padding "keysize + ptrsize"
00948          * covers the "dx_countlimit" and the "idle_blocks". */
00949         LASSERT((keysize + ptrsize) >=
00950                 (sizeof(struct dx_countlimit) + sizeof(__u32)));
00951 
00952         entry = (void *)(limit + 1);
00953         /* Put "idle_blocks" just after the limit. There was padding after
00954          * the limit, the "idle_blocks" re-uses part of the padding, so no
00955          * compatibility issues with old layout.
00956          */
00957         *(__u32 *)entry = 0;
00958 
00959         /*
00960          * Skip over @limit.
00961          */
00962         entry = (void *)(root + 1) + isize;
00963 
00964         /*
00965          * Entry format is <key> followed by <ptr>. In the minimal tree
00966          * consisting of a root and single node, <key> is a minimal possible
00967          * key.
00968          */
00969         *(lvar_hash_t *)entry = 0;
00970         entry += sizeof(lvar_hash_t);
00971         /* now @entry points to <ptr> */
00972         if (ptrsize == 4)
00973                 *(u_int32_t *)entry = cpu_to_le32(1);
00974         else
00975                 *(u_int64_t *)entry = cpu_to_le64(1);
00976 }
00977 
00978 static int lvar_esize(int namelen, int recsize)
00979 {
00980         return (offsetof(struct lvar_leaf_entry, vle_key) +
00981                 namelen + recsize + LVAR_ROUND) & ~LVAR_ROUND;
00982 }
00983 
00984 static void lvar_leaf(void *buf,
00985                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00986 {
00987         struct lvar_leaf_header *head;
00988         struct lvar_leaf_entry  *entry;
00989 
00990         /* form leaf */
00991         head = buf;
00992         *head = (typeof(*head)) {
00993                 .vlh_magic = cpu_to_le16(IAM_LVAR_LEAF_MAGIC),
00994                 .vlh_used  = cpu_to_le16(sizeof *head + lvar_esize(0, recsize))
00995         };
00996         entry = (void *)(head + 1);
00997         *entry = (typeof(*entry)) {
00998                 .vle_hash    = 0,
00999                 .vle_keysize = 0
01000         };
01001         memset(e_rec(entry), 0, recsize);
01002         *(char *)e_rec(entry) = recsize;
01003 }
01004 
01005 int iam_lvar_create(struct inode *obj,
01006                     int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize, handle_t *handle)
01007 {
01008         struct buffer_head *root_node;
01009         struct buffer_head *leaf_node;
01010         struct super_block *sb;
01011 
01012         u32 blknr;
01013         int result = 0;
01014         unsigned long bsize;
01015 
01016         assert_corr(obj->i_size == 0);
01017 
01018         sb = obj->i_sb;
01019         bsize = sb->s_blocksize;
01020         root_node = osd_ldiskfs_append(handle, obj, &blknr);
01021         if (IS_ERR(root_node))
01022                 GOTO(out, result = PTR_ERR(root_node));
01023 
01024         leaf_node = osd_ldiskfs_append(handle, obj, &blknr);
01025         if (IS_ERR(leaf_node))
01026                 GOTO(out_root, result = PTR_ERR(leaf_node));
01027 
01028         lvar_root(root_node->b_data, bsize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
01029         lvar_leaf(leaf_node->b_data, bsize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
01030         ldiskfs_mark_inode_dirty(handle, obj);
01031         result = ldiskfs_handle_dirty_metadata(handle, NULL, root_node);
01032         if (result == 0)
01033                 result = ldiskfs_handle_dirty_metadata(handle, NULL, leaf_node);
01034         if (result != 0)
01035                 ldiskfs_std_error(sb, result);
01036 
01037         brelse(leaf_node);
01038 
01039         GOTO(out_root, result);
01040 
01041 out_root:
01042         brelse(root_node);
01043 out:
01044         return result;
01045 }
01046 
01047 static struct iam_operations lvar_ops = {
01048         .id_root_ptr    = lvar_root_ptr,
01049         .id_node_read   = iam_node_read,
01050         .id_node_init   = lvar_node_init,
01051         .id_node_check  = lvar_node_check,
01052         .id_node_load   = lvar_node_load,
01053         .id_ikeycmp     = lvar_ikeycmp,
01054         .id_root_inc    = lvar_root_inc,
01055         .id_ipd_alloc   = lvar_ipd_alloc,
01056         .id_ipd_free    = iam_ipd_free,
01057         .id_name        = "lvar"
01058 };
01059 
01060 static int lvar_guess(struct iam_container *c)
01061 {
01062         int result;
01063         struct buffer_head *bh;
01064         const struct lvar_root *root;
01065 
01066         assert_corr(c->ic_object != NULL);
01067 
01068         result = iam_node_read(c, lvar_root_ptr(c), NULL, &bh);
01069         if (result == 0) {
01070                 root = (void *)bh->b_data;
01071                 if (le32_to_cpu(root->vr_magic) == IAM_LVAR_ROOT_MAGIC) {
01072                         struct iam_descr *descr;
01073 
01074                         descr = c->ic_descr;
01075                         descr->id_key_size  = LDISKFS_NAME_LEN;
01076                         descr->id_ikey_size = sizeof (lvar_hash_t);
01077                         descr->id_rec_size  = le16_to_cpu(root->vr_recsize);
01078                         descr->id_ptr_size  = le16_to_cpu(root->vr_ptrsize);
01079                         descr->id_root_gap  = sizeof *root;
01080                         descr->id_node_gap  = 0;
01081                         descr->id_ops       = &lvar_ops;
01082                         descr->id_leaf_ops  = &lvar_leaf_ops;
01083 
01084                         c->ic_root_bh = bh;
01085                 } else {
01086                         result = -EBADF;
01087                         brelse(bh);
01088                 }
01089         }
01090         return result;
01091 }
01092 
01093 static struct iam_format lvar_format = {
01094         .if_guess = lvar_guess
01095 };
01096 
01097 void iam_lvar_format_init(void)
01098 {
01099         iam_format_register(&lvar_format);
01100 }
